definition: Foreign Secretary/(UK) Secretary of State for Foreign and Commonwealth Affairs
to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
state official or subject in dynastic China/I, your servant (used in addressing the sovereign)/Kangxi radical 131

sentences.english: Former British Foreign Secretary Malcolm Rifkind rejects that notion.
sentences.chinese: 英國前外交大臣裏夫金德反駁了這種看法。

sentences.english: Danish Foreign Minister Per Stig Moller immediately condemned the blast.
sentences.chinese: 丹麥外交大臣默勒立即譴責了爆炸襲擊。

sentences.english: John has paged the Foreign Minister.
sentences.chinese: 約翰曾給外交大臣當過聽差。

sentences.english: It was decided instead that the Foreign Secretary should dismiss Hitler's gesture in a broadcast.
sentences.chinese: 於是決定改由外交大臣通過廣播拒絕希特勒的姿態。

sentences.english: Danish Foreign Minister Per Stig Moller immediately condemned the blast.
sentences.chinese: 丹麥外交大臣默勒立即譴責了爆炸襲擊。

sentences.english: The Foreign Secretary presented his credentials to the king.
sentences.chinese: 那位外交大臣向國王呈遞了國書。

definition: prime minister (of Japan or UK etc)
minister/diplomat performing ambassadorial role in Qing times, before regular diplomatic relations
